intro: Ligusticum archangelica, commonly known as angelica, is a tall biennial or perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features large, umbrella-shaped compound leaves and tall, clustered flowers that range from white to pale yellow. The plant contains essential oils, lignans, and other bioactive compounds, contributing to its use in traditional medicine. Its roots and stems are often harvested for their aromatic properties and medicinal applications. Ligusticum archangelica thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or wetland habitats.
